basicInfo.parentCompany: CVC Capital Partners (majority stake acquired Sept 2025)
basicInfo.notes: Founded by Richard Kirkendall. Second-largest domain registrar globally with 12M+ domains under management. CVC Capital Partners acquired majority stake in Sept 2025 for $1.5B valuation. Current CEO is Hillan Klein (replaced founder Dec 2025). Headquarters in Phoenix, AZ. 2,000 employees across 6 continents.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Only first-time accounts eligible; Renewals only within 48 hours; Dedicated servers 7 days from delivery; Domains 5 days (120 hours); Premium domains non-refundable; SSL only within 90 days of purchase and 15 days of activation; Private Email within 7 days; Third-party products (WHMCS, cPanel, Softaculous) non-refundable

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Unmetered within fair use; excessive use may require upgrade
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Hard limits apply; accounts exceeding 25GB removed from weekly backup
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violations result in warning, suspension, or immediate termination at Namecheap's discretion; no refund for TOS violations
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Exceeding 300,000 inodes; more than 10GB multimedia files; more than 10GB archive/database files; excessive CPU/memory usage affecting other users
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: UK/EU datacenter locations cost $1/month extra; VPS backup download $15 fee; cPanel not included on VPS/Dedicated (extra $15.88+/mo); CloudLinux extra $20/mo on dedicated; renewal prices roughly double promotional rates

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: 20-35% commission; 30-day cookie; via Impact Radius, CJ, or ShareASale

editorial.knownIssues: No phone support; BBB rating D- due to 159 unanswered complaints; VPS/Dedicated only available in US datacenter; renewal prices roughly double promo rates; ASGI Python apps not supported on shared hosting; some users report domain/account issues without explanation
editorial.bestFor: Budget-conscious users; Domain registration (2nd largest registrar); Developers needing Node.js/Python on shared hosting; Users who prefer chat over phone support; Cryptocurrency payment users
editorial.avoidIf: Need phone support; Adult or gambling content; Enterprise compliance requirements (no SOC2/HIPAA); Need VPS outside US; Prefer established BBB-accredited companies
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Cheaper than GoDaddy at both promo and renewal; Better developer support (Node.js, Python) than GoDaddy/Bluehost; No phone support unlike GoDaddy/HostGator; Better value than GoDaddy for domains; Free migration with 24hr guarantee beats most competitors; Accepts crypto payments unlike most hosts

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Best value domain registrar with developer-friendly hosting and crypto payments
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Budget-conscious developer or domain investor wanting value and technical flexibility

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Namecheap is excellent for budget-conscious users and developers, with great value and Node.js/Python support, but lacks phone support.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Namecheap was founded by Richard Kirkendall. CVC Capital Partners acquired a majority stake in September 2025.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Namecheap shared hosting starts at $1.98/month (promo) and renews at $4.48/month. First year costs approximately $24.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Yes, Namecheap offers cPanel, good documentation, and easy WordPress installation, making it beginner-friendly.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, Namecheap includes up to 30 email accounts with shared hosting plans.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, Namecheap offers WordPress hosting with auto-install and auto-updates.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Namecheap guarantees 100% uptime with SLA credits for any downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a 30-day money-back guarantee for first-time accounts. Renewals have a 48-hour window.
